author: geemo_candama
content: It's not clear to me what `update.finalized_header` and `update.finality_branch` should be when `create_light_client_update` is called with finalized_block  == None . Could someone clear this up for me? Thanks

author: etan_status
content:
both of those members will be filled with zeroes in that case.
it can happen, for example if you do a checkpoint sync, then the first couple blocks in your DB will point to finalized states that are before your checkpoint.

author: geemo_candama
content: Why wouldn't you set them to None and have the finalized_header and finality_branch fields of LightClientUpdate be optional?

author: etan_status
content:
SSZ does not have the concept of optional fields, so on the wire it needs to be present.
as this is just for an edge case, there is not too much overall saving, and the choice was to just use the same type in either case

author: etan_status
content: also, it has the neat property that you can convert LightClientOptimisticUpdate to LightClientFinalityUpdate to LightClientUpdate by just filling the rest with zeroes, and then processing the same logic. reduces code size

author: geemo_candama
content: Ohh that makes sense thank you
